humanum_full_description_en:
" Chen " is like a large shell of clams, that is, the early text of " mirage ". When ancient farm tools were not developed, they were used as tools for farming and weeding (Guo Moruo). Qiu Xigui believed that " chen " was not a shell, but " hoe " a class of tools used to clear vegetation, equivalent to the current short handle hoe. The word " chen " is borrowed to indicate the hour of time.

" Chen " farm tools are mainly used to remove weeds and small shrubs. To remove larger trees, tools such as axes and catties are needed (Qiu Xigui). The characters " nong " and " humiliation " come from " chen ", which means holding agricultural tools to weed, see " nong " and " humiliation ".

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the earthly branch and the name of the country, and the bronze inscriptions are used as the earthly branch, and it also means that the time of the day, Yihou Suogui: "(only) April is in Dingwei". Also used as the clan name and personal name.

"Said Wen": "Chen, Zhen Ye. In March, Yang Qiong, Qi electric vibration, people and farmers. All things are born, from B, dagger, and Manda; factory, sound. Chen, house star, sky Time is also. From two to two, the words are written in ancient Chinese. All the belongings of Fanchen are from Congchen. ğ ¨·, Gu Wenchen."

" Chen" is like a large shell of clams, that is, the early text of " mirage". When ancient farm tools were not developed, they were used as tools for farming and weeding (Guo Moruo). Qiu Xigui believed that " chen" was not a shell, but " hoe" a class of tools used to clear vegetation, equivalent to the current short handle hoe. The word " chen" is borrowed to indicate the hour of time. " Chen" farm tools are mainly used to remove weeds and small shrubs. To remove larger trees, tools such as axes and catties are needed (Qiu Xigui). The characters " nong" and " humiliation" come from " chen", which means holding agricultural tools to weed, see " nong" and " humiliation". The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the earthly branch and the name of the country, and the bronze inscriptions are used as the earthly branch, and it also means that the time of the day, Yihou Suogui: "(only) April is in Dingwei". Also used as the clan name and personal name. "Said Wen": "Chen, Zhen Ye. In March, Yang Qiong, Qi electric vibration, people and farmers. All things are born, from B, dagger, and Manda; factory, sound. Chen, house star, sky Time is also. From two to two, the words are written in ancient Chinese. All the belongings of Fanchen are from Congchen. ğ ¨·, Gu Wenchen."

Basic explanation of words

The fifth place of the earthly branch belongs to the dragon.
Used to keep track of time: Chen Shi (from 7 am to 9 am).
Time: Chenguang. Time. birthday.
The general term for sun, moon and stars: Beichen (North Star). Stars.

Chen
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[â‘ ]ï¼»chÃ©nï¼½
["Guangyun" planting neighbors, plain and true, Zen. ]
(1) Vibration, vibration.
(2) The fifth place of the earthly branches. In the Tai Sui Chronicle Method, it matches with the heavenly stems and is used to record the year.
(3) The fifth place of the earthly branches. Used to record the month, refers to the third month of the lunar calendar.
(4) The fifth place of the earthly branches. Used to record the day.
(5) The fifth place of the earthly branches. It is one of the twelve o'clock when it is used to record. Refers to 7 to 9 o'clock in the morning.
(6) The general term for the twelve earthly branches.
(7) One of the zodiac signs. Belongs to the dragon.
(8) Refers to the east-southeast direction. See "Tatsumi".
(9) Day; time.
(10) The name of the stars. Refers to one of the twenty-eight nights. Also known as fire.
(11) Polaris. Namely Beichen.
(12) The collective term for sun, moon, and star.
(13) Refers to the stars in general. See "stars".
(14) Refers to the meeting point of the sun, the moon, and the moon. That is, the position of the sun at the new moon of the twelve months of the lunar calendar year.
(15) Lengthen and stretch.
(16) Beautiful and good-looking.
(17) The name of the emperor. See "Chenju", "Chenheng".
(18) Through "morning".
(19) Ancient place names. Refers to Chenzhou. See "Cinnabar".
